What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A lot of Japanese - I became more fluent and now know a lot more phrases.
Japanese language  including nuances of how colloquial speak works and what might sound odd to a native speaker.

This course completely immersed me in the Japanese language every day of the semester. Through this immersion, I was able to learn a lot about Japanese culture, language, and people, in a way I never thought I could before. I properly learned, and retained, new knowledge of grammar structures and kanji formation, and I was able to communicate new thoughts and expressions to my classmates!

Topics: daily routines, physical well-being, food tastes, weather, emotions, occupations, "looks/seems like," casual speech, "to become," "X is better than Y,"  cooking vocabulary, "before/after X, I did Y," "to be able to X," "if X, then Y"
We learned Tobira I L7-10 and II L11-12.
continued my knowledge of all aspects of the Japanese language and culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was structured to facilitate learning - I learned a lot every single week and the assignments were fun to do.

Strong  format of course is strong, regular homework was engaging and challenging. Learned a lot, classroom environment was great for language learning and trying new grammar and words. 
Weaknesses - only thing i would've liked more of would be maybe vocabulary quizzes
Strengths: Professor Stever was an amazing teacher. The course was well organized and I learned a lot.

Overall, the material in this course is very strong and there's basically nothing I can think of that can be improved. Perhaps the one improvement could be to include more out-of-class collaboration. I think the entire class wants to get to know each other, they just need to be given a method to so. At one point in the year, everyone's just sitting in the same seats for the rest of the year so it's hard to get to know people from the other side of classroom. I think full-class activities, out-of-class activities, or maybe making people move seats throughout semester could make this easier.

STRENGTHS: solid language class, you learn at a pretty fast pace but it's rewarding // WEAKNESSES: this class was oversubscribed the semester I took it (18 students in a class that should've been capped at 12), so I wish we got more speaking practice. Other than that, class was good
It is very intense in that students have classes and homework every day, so I did feel like I laid a solid foundation of the language. Classes are usually very interesting. Feedback is very prompt.
the small class size lent to plenty of time to practice my Japanese in the classroom. The teacher was very kind and encouraged student engagement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Be prepared to do a lot of work but all of these assignments help your understanding of the material. I would definitely recommend this class if you are interested in Japan and Japanese culture.
Yes! The class was well taught, Professor Stever did a great job of creating a good class environment and I feel like I learned a whole lot this semester.
Yes! It was very fun and I learned a lot.

For anyone trying to learn Japanese, I would most definitely recommend this course. The amount of work seems just right to me to facilitate proper learning and I really feel like I have a better grip of the language now.
Yes, it's a great way to learn Japanese
Yes if youre interested in Japanese!
I would definitely recommend this course. Teacher is great and course is fun.
